definition: to contract for an entire project
surname Cheng/Cheng (c. 2000 BC), third of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to bear/to carry/to hold/to continue/to undertake/to take charge/owing to/due to/to receive
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass

sentences.english: Can David foresee the end of the job work?
sentences.chinese: 戴維能預知承攬工作的結果嗎？

sentences.english: An independent contractor is not regarded as an auxiliary for the purposes of this Article.
sentences.chinese: 獨立承攬人不作爲本條的輔助者對待。

sentences.english: All-round undertaking caisson shift within the one million tons and marine floating transport project.
sentences.chinese: 全方位承攬自重萬噸以內的沉箱移位和海上浮運工程。

sentences.english: B： Yes， we arrange shipments to any part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我們承攬去世界各地的貨物運輸。
我們承攬切紙加工業務。

sentences.english: If the client still fails to fulfill its obligation beyond the time limit, the contractor may dissolve the contract.
sentences.chinese: 定作人逾期不履行的，承攬人可以解除合同。

sentences.english: We arrange shipments to any part of the world.
sentences.chinese: 我們承攬去世界各地的貨物運輸。

sentences.english: The company also can produce various kinds of iron castings and nonferrous castings.
sentences.chinese: 公司還可承攬各類鑄鐵件和有色鑄件。

sentences.english: In the contract for work, the maker assumes the liability for warranty against defect.
sentences.chinese: 在承攬合同中，承攬人要承擔瑕疵擔保責任。

sentences.english: In the contract for work, the maker assumes the liability for warranty against defect.
sentences.chinese: 在承攬合同中，承攬人要承擔瑕疵擔保責任。

sentences.english: The construction brigade undertook the construction work of this section of the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 這個工程隊承攬了修建這段路面的任務。
